question_text: Why is the LC connector commonly used in high-density network environments?
answer_options: It uses a bayonet locking system for strength
Its clip-style latch allows it to carry electrical signals
Its small form factor allows more connections in less space
It supports wireless signal boosting through optical gain
correct_answer: Its small form factor allows more connections in less space
explanation: LC (Lucent Connector) is favored in high-density environments due to its compact size and clip latch mechanism.
